00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 parserRadioButtons.pl - Radio buttons compatible with Value objects, specifically MultiAnswer objects.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 This file implements a radio button group object that is compatible
00024 with Value objects, and in particular, with the MultiAnswer object.
00025 
00026 To create a RadioButtons object, use
00027 
00028     $radio = RadioButtons([choices,...],correct,options);
00029 
00030 where "choices" are the strings for the items in the radio buttons,
00031 "correct" is the choice that is the correct answer for the group,
00032 and options are chosen from among:
00033 
00034 =over
00035 
00036 =item C<S<< order => [choice,...] >>>
00037 
00038 Specifies the order in which choices should be presented. All choices must be
00039 listed. If this option is specified, the C<first> and C<last> options are
00040 ignored.
00041 
00042 =item C<S<< first => [choice,...] >>>
00043 
00044 Specifies choices which should appear first, in the order specified, in the list
00045 of choices. Ignored if the C<order> option is specified.
00046 
00047 =item C<S<< last => [choice,...] >>>
00048 
00049 Specifies choices which should appear last, in the order specified, in the list
00050 of choices. Ignored if the C<order> option is specified.
00051 
00052 =item C<S<< labels => [label1,...] >>>
00053 
00054 Specifies the text to be used
00055 as the student answer for each
00056 entry in the radio group.
00057 This can also be set to the string
00058 "ABC" to get lettered labels or
00059 "123" to get numbered labels.
00060 The default is to use a few words
00061 from the text string for each button.
00062 
00063 =item C<S<< separator => string >>>
00064 
00065 text to put between the radio
00066 buttons.
00067 Default: $BR
00068 
00069 =item C<S<< checked => choice >>>
00070 
00071 the text or index (starting at zero)
00072 of the button to be checked
00073 Default: none checked
00074 
00075 =item C<S<< maxLabelSize => n >>>
00076 
00077 the approximate largest size that should
00078 be used for the answer strings to be
00079 generated by the radio buttons (if
00080 the choice strings are too long, they
00081 will be trimmed and "..." inserted)
00082 Default: 25
00083 
00084 =item C<S<< uncheckable => 0 or 1 or "shift" >>>
00085 
00086 determines whether the radio buttons can
00087 be unchecked (requires JavaScript).
00088 To uncheck, click a second time; when
00089 set to "shift", unchecking requires the
00090 shift key to be pressed.
00091 Default: 0
00092 
00093 =back
00094 
00095 To insert the radio buttons into the problem text, use
00096 
00097     BEGIN_TEXT
00098     \{$radio->buttons\}
00099     END_TEXT
00100 
00101 and then
00102 
00103     ANS($radio->cmp);
00104 
00105 to get the answer checker for the radion buttons.
00106 
00107 You can use the RadioButtons object in MultiPart objects.  This is
00108 the reason for the RadioButton's ans_rule method (since that is what
00109 MultiPart calls to get answer rules).
00110 
00111 =cut
00112 
00113 loadMacros('MathObjects.pl','contextString.pl');
00114 
00115 sub _parserRadioButtons_init {parserRadioButtons::Init()}; # don't reload this file

00117 ##################################################
00118 #
00119 #  The package that implements RadioButtons
00120 #
00121 package parserRadioButtons;
00122 our @ISA = qw(Value::String);
00123 
00124 my $jsPrinted = 0;  # true when the JavaScript has been printed
00125 
00126 #
00127 #  Set up the main:: namespace
00128 #
00129 sub Init {
00130   $jsPrinted = 0;
00131   main::PG_restricted_eval('sub RadioButtons {parserRadioButtons->new(@_)}');
00132 }
00133 
00134 #
00135 #  Create a new RadioButtons object
00136 #
00137 sub new {
00138   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00139   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00140   my $choices = shift; my $value = shift;
00141   my %options;
00142   main::set_default_options(\%options,
00143     labels => [],
00144     separator => $main::BR,
00145     checked => undef,
00146     maxLabelSize => 25,
00147     uncheckable => 0,
00148     first => undef,
00149     last => undef,
00150     order => undef,
00151     @_,
00152   );
00153   $options{labels} = [1..scalar(@$choices)] if $options{labels} eq "123";
00154   $options{labels} = [@main::ALPHABET[0..scalar(@$choices)-1]] if $options{labels} eq "ABC";
00155   my $self = bless {%options, choices=>$choices}, $class; # temporary to so we can call our methods
00156   Value::Error("A RadioButton's first argument should be a list of button labels")
00157     unless ref($choices) eq 'ARRAY';
00158   Value::Error("A RadioButton's second argument should be the correct button choice")
00159     unless defined($value) && $value ne "";
00160   my $context = Parser::Context->getCopy("String");
00161   my %choiceHash = $self->choiceHash;
00162   $context->strings->add(map {$_=>{}} (keys %choiceHash));
00163   $value = $self->correctChoice($value);
00164   $self = bless $context->Package("String")->new($context,$value)->with(choices => $choices, %options), $class;
00165   $self->JavaScript if $self->{uncheckable};
00166   return $self;
00167 }
00168 
00169 #
00170 #  Given a choice, a label, or an index into the choices array,
00171 #    return the label.
00172 #
00173 sub findChoice {
00174   my $self = shift; my $value = shift;
00175   my $index = $self->Index($value);
00176   foreach my $i (0..scalar(@{$self->{choices}})-1) {
00177     my $label = $self->{labels}[$i]; my $choice = $self->{choices}[$i];
00178     $label = $choice unless defined $label;
00179     return $label if $label eq $value || $index == $i || $choice eq $value;
00180   }
00181  return undef;
00182 }
00183 
00184 #
00185 #  Locate the label of the correct answer
00186 #  The answer can be given as an index, as the full answer
00187 #    or as the label itself.
00188 #
00189 sub correctChoice {
00190   my $self = shift; my $value = shift;
00191   my $choice = $self->findChoice($value);
00192   return $choice if defined $choice;
00193   Value::Error("The correct answer should be one of the button choices");
00194 }
00195 
00196 #
00197 #  Create the hash of label => answer pairs to be used for the
00198 #  ans_radio_buttons() routine
00199 #
00200 sub choiceHash {
00201   my $self = shift; my @radio = (); my %labels;
00202   foreach my $i (0..scalar(@{$self->{choices}})-1) {
00203     my $label = $self->{labels}[$i]; my $choice = $self->{choices}[$i];
00204     $label = $choice unless defined $label;
00205     push(@radio, $label,$choice);
00206   }
00207   return @radio;
00208 }
00209 
00210 #
00211 #  Create a label for the answer, either using the labels
00212 #  provided by the author, or by creating one from the answer
00213 #  string (restrict its length so that the results table
00214 #  will not be overflowed).
00215 #
00216 sub labelText {
00217   my $self = shift; my $choice = shift;
00218   return $choice if length($choice) < $self->{maxLabelSize};
00219   my @words = split(/\b/,$choice); my ($s,$e) = ('','');
00220   do {$s .= shift(@words); $e = pop(@words) . $e}
00221     while length($s) + length($e) + 15 < $self->{maxLabelSize} && scalar(@words);
00222   return $s . " ... " . $e;
00223 }
00224 
00225 #
00226 #  Get a numeric index (-1 if not defined or not a number)
00227 #
00228 sub Index {
00229   my $self = shift; my $index = shift;
00230   return -1 unless defined $index && $index =~ m/^\d$/;
00231   return $index;
00232 }
00233 
00234 #
00235 #  Print the JavaScript needed for uncheckable radio buttons
00236 #
00237 sub JavaScript {
00238   return if $jsPrinted || $main::displayMode eq 'TeX';
00239   main::TEXT(
00240     "\n<script>\n" .
00241     "if (window.ww == null) {var ww = {}}\n" .
00242     "if (ww.RadioButtons == null) {ww.RadioButtons = {}}\n" .
00243     "if (ww.RadioButtons.selected == null) {ww.RadioButtons.selected = {}}\n" .
00244     "ww.RadioButtons.Toggle = function (obj,event,shift) {\n" .
00245     "  if (!event) {event = window.event}\n" .
00246     "  if (shift && !event.shiftKey) {\n" .
00247     "    this.selected[obj.name] = obj\n" .
00248     "    return\n" .
00249     "  }\n" .
00250     "  var selected = this.selected[obj.name]\n" .
00251     "  if (selected && selected == obj) {\n".
00252     "    this.selected[obj.name] = null\n" .
00253     "    obj.checked = false\n" .
00254     "  } else {\n" .
00255     "    this.selected[obj.name] = obj\n".
00256     "  }\n" .
00257     "}\n".
00258     "</script>\n"
00259   );
00260   $jsPrinted = 1;
00261 }
00262 
00263 sub makeUncheckable {
00264   my $self = shift;
00265   my $shift = ($self->{uncheckable} =~ m/shift/i ? ",1" : "");
00266   my $onclick = "onclick=\"ww.RadioButtons.Toggle(this,event$shift)\"";
00267   my @radio = @_;
00268   foreach (@radio) {$_ =~ s/<INPUT/<INPUT $onclick/i}
00269   return @radio;
00270 }
00271 
00272 #
00273 #  Determine the order the choices should be in.
00274 #
00275 sub orderedChoices {
00276   my $self = shift;
00277   my %choiceHash = $self->choiceHash;
00278   my @labels = keys %choiceHash;
00279 
00280   my @order = @{$self->{order} || []};
00281   my @first = @{$self->{first} || []};
00282   my @last  = @{$self->{last}  || []};
00283 
00284   my @orderLabels;
00285 
00286   if (@order) {
00287     my %remainingChoices = %choiceHash;
00288     Value::Error("When using the 'order' option, you must list all possible choices.")
00289       unless @order == @labels;
00290     foreach my $i (0..$#order) {
00291       my $label = $self->findChoice($order[$i]);
00292       Value::Error("Item $i of the 'order' option is not a choice.")
00293         if not defined $label;
00294       Value::Error("Item $i of the 'order' option was already specified.")
00295         if not exists $remainingChoices{$label};
00296       push @orderLabels, $label;
00297       delete $remainingChoices{$label};
00298     }
00299   } elsif (@first or @last) {
00300     my @firstLabels;
00301     my @lastLabels;
00302     my %remainingChoices = %choiceHash;
00303 
00304     foreach my $i (0..$#first) {
00305       my $label = $self->findChoice($first[$i]);
00306       Value::Error("Item $i of the 'first' option is not a choice.")
00307     if not defined $label;
00308       Value::Error("Item $i of the 'first' option was already specified.")
00309     if not exists $remainingChoices{$label};
00310       push @firstLabels, $label;
00311       delete $remainingChoices{$label};
00312     }
00313 
00314     foreach my $i (0..$#last) {
00315       my $label = $self->findChoice($last[$i]);
00316       Value::Error("Item $i of the 'last' option is not a choice.")
00317     if not defined $label;
00318       Value::Error("Item $i of the 'last' option was already specified.")
00319     if not exists $remainingChoices{$label};
00320       push @lastLabels, $label;
00321       delete $remainingChoices{$label};
00322     }
00323 
00324     @orderLabels = (@firstLabels, keys %remainingChoices, @lastLabels);
00325   } else {
00326     # use the order of elements in the hash
00327     # this is the current behavior
00328     # might we want to explicitly randomize these?
00329     @orderLabels = @labels;
00330   }
00331 
00332   my $label = $self->findChoice($self->{checked});
00333   return map { ($_ eq $label ? "%$_" : $_) => $choiceHash{$_} } @orderLabels;
00334 }
00335 
00336 #
00337 #  Create the radio-buttons text
00338 #
00339 sub buttons {
00340   my $self = shift;
00341   my @radio = main::ans_radio_buttons($self->orderedChoices);
00342   @radio = $self->makeUncheckable(@radio) if $self->{uncheckable};
00343   (wantarray) ? @radio : join($self->{separator}, @radio);
00344 }
00345 sub named_buttons {
00346   my $self = shift; my $name = shift;
00347   my @radio = NAMED_ANS_RADIO_BUTTONS($name,$self->orderedChoices);
00348   @radio = $self->makeUncheckable(@radio) if $self->{uncheckable};
00349   #
00350   #  Taken from PGbasicmacros.pl
00351   #  It is wrong to have \item in the radio buttons and to add itemize here,
00352   #    but that is the way PGbasicmacros.pl does it.
00353   #
00354   if ($displayMode eq 'TeX') {
00355     $radio[0] = "\n\\begin{itemize}\n" . $radio[0];
00356     $radio[$#radio_buttons] .= "\n\\end{itemize}\n";
00357   }
00358   (wantarray) ? @radio: join($self->{separator}, @radio);
00359 }
00360 
00361 sub ans_rule {shift->buttons(@_)}
00362 sub named_ans_rule {shift->named_buttons(@_)}
00363 
00364 sub cmp_postprocess {
00365   my $self = shift; my $ans = shift;
00366   my $text = $self->labelText($ans->{student_value}->value);
00367   $ans->{preview_text_string} = $ans->{student_ans} = $text;
00368   $ans->{preview_latex_string} = "\\hbox{$text}";
00369 }
